alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 6:43PM EDT until June 13 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following counties, Greene and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 643 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dayton, Kettering, Beavercreek, Fairborn, Xenia, Trotwood, Miamisburg, Bellbrook, Moraine, Oakwood, Wright-Patterson Afb, West Carrollton, Riverside, Shiloh, Spring Valley, Centerville, Overlook-Page Mano, Woodbourne-Hyde Park, Greene County Airport and Trebein.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
